intro: Rebutia tiraquensis, commonly known as the Tiraquén cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of South America, specifically Chile. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and spiny stems. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the spring and summer seasons. Rebutia tiraquensis is well adapted to dry conditions, with thick, fleshy stems that store water. It is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal.
